question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_signatures_per_txn] [Arithmetic Overflow] Can max_signatures_per_txn * authenticator_size overflow usize when allocating space for authenticator validation, causing heap corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_signatures_per_txn] [Gas Exhaustion] Can max_signatures_per_txn be set high enough that validating maximum authenticators exceeds block gas limit, making transactions unprocessable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_exp_horizon_secs] [Time Manipulation] Can max_exp_horizon_secs validation be bypassed through timestamp manipulation attacks where attacker controls block timestamp? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_exp_horizon_secs] [Integer Overflow] Can current_timestamp + max_exp_horizon_secs overflow u64 causing expiration check to wrap around and accept expired signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: training_wheels_pubkey] [Key Substitution] Can training_wheels_pubkey be changed mid-transaction-processing causing some authenticators to be validated with old key and others with new key in same block? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: training_wheels_pubkey] [Weak Key] Can training_wheels_pubkey be set to weak or compromised Ed25519 key (e.g., key=0x00..00) that attackers can find discrete log for? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_commited_epk_bytes] [Size Mismatch] Can max_commited_epk_bytes be set larger than ephemeral public key size allowing oversized keys that break cryptographic assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_commited_epk_bytes] [Size Mismatch] Can max_commited_epk_bytes be set smaller than minimum key size causing all keyless transactions to fail validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_iss_val_bytes] [JWT Attack] Can max_iss_val_bytes limit be too permissive allowing excessively long JWT issuer strings that cause buffer overflows in downstream processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_iss_val_bytes] [JWT Attack] Can max_iss_val_bytes be set too restrictive rejecting legitimate long issuer URLs from certain OIDC providers locking users out? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_extra_field_bytes] [JWT Attack] Can max_extra_field_bytes limit be circumvented by splitting large extra fields across multiple JWT claims bypassing validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_extra_field_bytes] [Resource Exhaustion] Can max_extra_field_bytes be set to u16::MAX allowing 65KB extra fields that cause memory exhaustion when processing many keyless transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_jwt_header_b64_bytes] [Base64 Attack] Can max_jwt_header_b64_bytes validation be bypassed using alternate base64 encodings (URL-safe, no padding) that decode to larger size? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Field: max_jwt_header_b64_bytes] [Compression Attack] Can malicious JWT headers be crafted with base64-encoded compressed data that expands massively during decoding bypassing size limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: is_allowed_override_aud()] [Error Handling] Does invalid_signature! macro properly propagate VMStatus error, or can error be silently swallowed causing validation to incorrectly succeed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: is_allowed_override_aud()] [Edge Case] Can is_allowed_override_aud() handle override_aud_vals being empty vector correctly, or does it incorrectly succeed/fail validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Trait: AsMoveValue] [Error Handling] Can as_move_value() panic or return invalid MoveValue for certain field combinations, causing transaction execution to abort unexpectedly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Boundary Case] Can Configuration handle maximum field values (u16::MAX, u64::MAX) correctly in all code paths, or do some operations assume smaller values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Boundary Case] Can Configuration handle minimum field values (0, empty vector) correctly, or do some operations perform division by zero or require non-empty values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Memory Safety] Can override_aud_vals vector be modified while references to its elements exist, causing use-after-free vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Memory Safety] Can training_wheels_pubkey Vec<u8> be freed while slice references exist in validation code, causing dangling pointer access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: is_allowed_override_aud()] [Memory Safety] Can the filter().count() pattern cause iterator invalidation if override_aud_vals is modified during iteration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Clone Safety] Does Configuration implement Clone correctly for all fields including Option<Vec<u8>>, or can cloning cause shallow copies leading to aliasing bugs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Drop Safety] Does Configuration require custom Drop implementation to clean up resources, and can dropping Configuration while in use cause resource leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Constant: OVERRIDE_AUD_FOR_TESTING] [Test Leakage] Can OVERRIDE_AUD_FOR_TESTING='test.recovery.aud' be used in production if test code is accidentally included in release builds? (Critical)
